intro: Duravia greenei, commonly known as the Greene's duravia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Duravia greenei is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
